channel.title: A C64 Theme for Jekyll
channel.description: Get blogging like it's 1985 with this Commodore 64 theme for Jekyll, the simple, blog aware, static site generator from GitHub.

item.title: Let's get blogging
item.description:
There are lots of good reasons to keep a blog. It will help to improve your writing, maintain a useful habit, and help shape your thoughts.

You might also help and inspire others by sharing your point of view.

So, why not getting blogging with this handsome C64 inspired theme?

item.title: Can a Commodore 64 connect to the internet?
item.description:
The answer is yes! This amazing video by Dan Wood of KookyTech shows how.

Highlights include downloading ROMs off the Internet directly to disk, and browsing the web using a version of the Lynx browser.

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on the Jekyll dedicated Help repository.
